title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.3 | 31-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and invocations, setting a spiritual tone.

segments.key_quote: The effect of such a bona fide hearing and chanting of Srimad Bhagavatam was equally shared by both the hearer and the chanter.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam about Maharaj Pariksit and Sukadev Goswami, emphasizing the mutual benefit of hearing and chanting.

segments.key_quote: Pariksit Maharaj attained perfection simply by hearing properly the Srimad Bhagavatam as was spoken to him by Sukadev Goswami.
segments.summary: The lecture expands on the nine processes of devotional service (Navavidha Bhakti), highlighting how Pariksit Maharaj and Sukadev Goswami achieved perfection through hearing and chanting.

segments.key_quote: Transcendental realization is attained by such serious hearing and chanting and not otherwise.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts genuine devotional service with bogus methods of spiritual realization, particularly criticizing the idea of transferring spiritual power through touch.
The speaker continues to strongly condemn false spiritual practices, describing them as rubbish and nonsense, warning against being victimized by such advertisements.
The speaker emphasizes that authentic Vedic literature focuses on hearing and speaking, not on physical touch or miraculous experiences, reiterating the warning against false practices.

segments.key_quote: If touch were to work, why there has to be so much of knowledge?
segments.summary: The speaker questions the need for extensive scriptures and commentaries if enlightenment could be achieved through touch, highlighting the importance of knowledge and the role of acharyas.

segments.key_quote: Ardent hearing from the bona fide master is the only way to receive transcendental knowledge
segments.summary: The speaker returns to the example of Sukadev Goswami and Maharaj Pariksit, emphasizing that ardent hearing from a bona fide master is the true path to transcendental knowledge.

segments.key_quote: The process is simple but only the sincere party can achieve the desired result
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the importance of sincere hearing from Srila Prabhupada or his representatives, encouraging questions and clear explanations, and reiterating the rejection of bogus practices.
